column4: I'm having nfs difficulties. Mounting is slow or returns this error: RPC timeout. ssh is also really slow to the server. Any ideas what could be wrong with the server and/or the network?
you have portmap installed and running?
I believe so. I'll ssh into the server and find out
It's not just nfs, ssh is also slow. I'm on a home network being routed through a wrt54G linksys router with the latest sveasoft firmware.
umm.. run rpcinfo -p on that server and you should get a whole bunch of stuff
yah, lots of stuff. Whole bunch of mountd, nlockmgn, nfs, status, sgi_fam and portmapper
your host.allow and hosts.deny are configured?
hosts.allow doesn't have anytyhing  in it that isn't commented out.
how would I allow everyone on the local network?
hang on I'll find you a link for nfs setup
your host.allow should have portmap, lockd, rquotad, mountd, statd  ... and you shoould configure hosts.deny as well
